description: All Microsoft Defender for Endpoints (MDE) tables related to Azure Sentinel.
icmTeam: Microsoft Azure Sentinel/Data Collection and Processing

tables.name: DeviceNetworkInfo
tables.description: Microsoft Defender for Endpoints (MDE) device network information table. This table contains Network properties of machines, including adapters, IP and MAC addresses, as well as connected networks and domains.

columns.description: Networks that the adapter is connected to. Each JSON element in the array contains the network name, category (public, private or domain), a description, and a flag indicating if it is connected publicly to the internet.
Default gateway addresses in JSON array format.

columns.name: DeviceId
columns.description: Unique identifier for the device in the service.

columns.name: DeviceName
columns.description: Fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the device.
DNS server addresses in JSON array format.
JSON array containing all the IP addresses assigned to the adapter, along with their respective subnet prefix and the IP class (RFC 1918 & RFC 4291).

columns.name: IPv4Dhcp
columns.description: IPv4 address of the configured DHCP server.

columns.name: IPv6Dhcp
columns.description: IPv6 address of the configured DHCP server.

columns.name: MacAddress
columns.description: MAC address of the network adapter.

columns.name: MachineGroup
columns.description: The machine-group which this machine is associated to. This group is used by role-based access control to determine access to the machine.

columns.name: NetworkAdapterName
columns.description: Name of the network adapter.

columns.name: NetworkAdapterStatus
columns.description: Operational status of the network adapter.

columns.name: NetworkAdapterType
columns.description: Network adapter type.

columns.name: ReportId
columns.description: Event identifier based on a repeating counter. To identify unique events, this column must be used in conjunction with the DeviceName and/or Timestamp columns.

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: Date and time the event was recorded by the MDE agent on the endpoint.

columns.name: Timestamp
columns.description: Date and time the event was recorded by the MDE agent on the endpoint. This is identical to TimeGenerated and added for query portability from MDE Advanced Hunting.

columns.name: TunnelType
columns.description: Tunneling protocol, when the interface is used for this purpose, for example 6to4, Teredo, ISATAP, PPTP, SSTP, and SSH.

columns.name: NetworkAdapterVendor
columns.description: Name of the manufacturer or vendor of the network adapter.

tables.name: DeviceNetworkEvents
tables.description: Microsoft Defender for Endpoints (MDE) device network events table. This table contains contains information about network connections and related events initiated by processes running on the endpoint.

columns.name: ActionType
columns.description: Type of activity that triggered the event.

columns.name: AdditionalFields
columns.description: Additional information about the entity or event.

columns.name: AppGuardContainerId
columns.description: Identifier for the virtualized container used by Application Guard to isolate browser activity.

columns.name: DeviceId
columns.description: Unique identifier for the device in the service.

columns.name: DeviceName
columns.description: Fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the device.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessAccountDomain
columns.description: Domain of the account that ran the initiating process.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessAccountName
columns.description: User name of the account that ran the initiating process.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessAccountObjectId
columns.description: Azure AD object ID of the user account that ran the initiating process.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessAccountSid
columns.description: Security Identifier (SID) of the account that ran the initiating process.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessAccountUpn
columns.description: User principal name (UPN) of the account that ran the initiating process.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessCommandLine
columns.description: Command line used to run the initiating process.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessFileName
columns.description: Name of the initiating process.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessFolderPath
columns.description: Folder containing the initiating process (image file).

columns.name: InitiatingProcessId
columns.description: Process ID (PID) of the initiating process.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessIntegrityLevel
columns.description: Integrity level of the initiating process. Windows assigns integrity levels to processes based on certain characteristics, such as if they were launched from an internet download. These integrity levels influence permissions to resources..

columns.name: InitiatingProcessMD5
columns.description: MD5 hash of the initiating process (image file).

columns.name: InitiatingProcessParentFileName
columns.description: Name of the parent process that spawned the initiating process.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessParentId
columns.description: Process ID (PID) of the parent process that spawned the initiating process.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessSHA1
columns.description: SHA-1 hash of the initiating process (image file).

columns.name: InitiatingProcessSHA256
columns.description: SHA-256 hash of the initiating process (image file). In some cases this column may not be populated - please use the InitiatingProcessSHA1 column instead.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessTokenElevation
columns.description: Token type indicating the presence or absence of User Access Control (UAC) privilege elevation applied to the initiating process.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessFileSize
columns.description: Size of the file (bytes) that ran the process responsible for the event.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessVersionInfoCompanyName
columns.description: The company name in version information (image file) responsible for the event.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessVersionInfoProductName
columns.description: The product name in version information (image file) responsible for the event.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessVersionInfoProductVersion
columns.description: The product version in version information (image file) responsible for the event.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessVersionInfoInternalFileName
columns.description: The internal file name in version information (image file) responsible for the event.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessVersionInfoOriginalFileName
columns.description: The original file name in version information (image file) responsible for the event.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessVersionInfoFileDescription
columns.description: The description in version information (image file) responsible for the event.

columns.name: LocalIP
columns.description: IP address assigned to the local machine used during communication.

columns.name: LocalIPType
columns.description: Type of IP address, for example Public, Private, Reserved, Loopback, Teredo, FourToSixMapping, and Broadcast.

columns.name: LocalPort
columns.description: TCP port on the local machine used during communication.

columns.name: MachineGroup
columns.description: Machine group of the machine. This group is used by role-based access control to determine access to the machine.

columns.name: Protocol
columns.description: IP protocol used, whether TCP or UDP.

columns.name: RemoteIP
columns.description: IP address that was being connected to.

columns.name: RemoteIPType
columns.description: Type of IP address, for example Public, Private, Reserved, Loopback, Teredo, FourToSixMapping, and Broadcast.

columns.name: RemotePort
columns.description: TCP port on the remote device that was being connected to.

columns.name: RemoteUrl
columns.description: URL or fully qualified domain name (FQDN) that was being connected to.

columns.name: ReportId
columns.description: Event identifier based on a repeating counter. To identify unique events, this column must be used in conjunction with the ComputerName and EventTime columns..

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: Date and time the event was recorded by the MDE agent on the endpoint.

columns.name: Timestamp
columns.description: Date and time the event was recorded by the MDE agent on the endpoint. This is identical to TimeGenerated and added for query portability from MDE Advanced Hunting.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessParentCreationTime
columns.description: Date and time when the parent of the process responsible for the event was started.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessCreationTime
columns.description: Date and time when the process that initiated the event was started.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessSessionId
columns.description: Windows session ID of the initiating process.

columns.name: IsInitiatingProcessRemoteSession
columns.description: Indicates whether the initiating process was run under a remote desktop protocol (RDP) session (true) or locally (false).

columns.name: InitiatingProcessRemoteSessionDeviceName
columns.description: Device name of the remote device from which the initiating process’s RDP session was initiated.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessRemoteSessionIP
columns.description: IP address of the remote device from which the initiating process’s RDP session was initiated.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessUniqueId
columns.description: Unique identifier of the initiating process; this is equal to the Process Start Key in Windows devices.

tables.name: DeviceProcessEvents
tables.description: Microsoft Defender for Endpoints (MDE) device process events table. This table contains contains information about process creation and related events on the endpoint.

columns.name: TenantId
columns.description: Users WorkspaceId.

columns.name: AccountDomain
columns.description: Domain of the account.

columns.name: AccountName
columns.description: User name of the account.

columns.name: AccountObjectId
columns.description: Unique identifier for the account in Azure AD.

columns.name: AccountSid
columns.description: Security Identifier (SID) of the account.

columns.name: AccountUpn
columns.description: User principal name (UPN) of the account.

columns.name: ActionType
columns.description: Type of activity that triggered the event.

columns.name: AdditionalFields
columns.description: Additional information about the entity or event.

columns.name: AppGuardContainerId
columns.description: Identifier for the virtualized container used by Application Guard to isolate browser activity.

columns.name: DeviceId
columns.description: Unique identifier for the device in the service.

columns.name: DeviceName
columns.description: Fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the device.

columns.name: FileName
columns.description: Name of the file that the recorded action was applied to.

columns.name: FolderPath
columns.description: Folder containing the file that the recorded action was applied to.

columns.name: FileSize
columns.description: Size of the file in bytes.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessAccountDomain
columns.description: Domain of the account that ran the process responsible for the event.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessAccountName
columns.description: User name of the account that ran the process responsible for the event.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessAccountObjectId
columns.description: Azure AD object ID of the user account that ran the process responsible for the event.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessAccountSid
columns.description: Security Identifier (SID) of the account that ran the process responsible for the event.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessAccountUpn
columns.description: User principal name (UPN) of the account that ran the process responsible for the event.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessCommandLine
columns.description: Command line used to run the process that initiated the event.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessFileName
columns.description: Name of the process that initiated the event.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessFolderPath
columns.description: Folder containing the process (image file) that initiated the event.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessId
columns.description: Process ID (PID) of the process that initiated the event.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessIntegrityLevel
columns.description: Integrity level of the process that initiated the event. Windows assigns integrity levels to processes based on certain characteristics, such as if they were launched from an internet download. These integrity levels influence permissions to resources..

columns.name: InitiatingProcessLogonId
columns.description: Identifier for a logon session of the process that initiated the event. This identifier is unique on the same machine only between restarts..

columns.name: InitiatingProcessMD5
columns.description: MD5 hash of the process (image file) that initiated the event.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessParentFileName
columns.description: Name of the parent process that spawned the process responsible for the event.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessParentId
columns.description: Process ID (PID) of the parent process that spawned the process responsible for the event.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessSHA1
columns.description: SHA-1 hash of the process (image file) that initiated the event.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessSHA256
columns.description: SHA-256 hash of the process (image file) that initiated the event. In some cases this column may not be populated - please use the InitiatingProcessSHA1 column instead.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessTokenElevation
columns.description: Token type indicating the presence or absence of User Access Control (UAC) privilege elevation applied to the process that initiated the event.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessFileSize
columns.description: The size of the file (bytes) that ran the process responsible for the event.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessVersionInfoCompanyName
columns.description: The company name in version information (image file) responsible for the event.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessVersionInfoProductName
columns.description: The product name in version information (image file) responsible for the event.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessVersionInfoProductVersion
columns.description: The product version in version information (image file) responsible for the event.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessVersionInfoInternalFileName
columns.description: The internal file name in version information (image file) responsible for the event.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessVersionInfoOriginalFileName
columns.description: The original file name in version information (image file) responsible for the event.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessVersionInfoFileDescription
columns.description: The description in version information (image file) responsible for the event.

columns.name: LogonId
columns.description: Identifier for a logon session. This identifier is unique on the same machine only between restarts.

columns.name: MD5
columns.description: MD5 hash of the file that the recorded action was applied to.

columns.name: MachineGroup
columns.description: Machine group of the machine. This group is used by role-based access control to determine access to the machine.

columns.name: ProcessCommandLine
columns.description: Command line used to create the new process.

columns.name: ProcessCreationTime
columns.description: Date and time the process was created.

columns.name: ProcessId
columns.description: Process ID (PID) of the newly created process.

columns.name: ProcessIntegrityLevel
columns.description: Integrity level of the newly created process. Windows assigns integrity levels to processes based on certain characteristics, such as if they were launched from an internet downloaded. These integrity levels influence permissions to resources..

columns.name: ProcessTokenElevation
columns.description: Token type indicating the presence or absence of User Access Control (UAC) privilege elevation applied to the newly created process.

columns.name: ProcessVersionInfoCompanyName
columns.description: Company name from the version information of the newly created process.

columns.name: ProcessVersionInfoProductName
columns.description: Product name from the version information of the newly created process.

columns.name: ProcessVersionInfoProductVersion
columns.description: Product version from the version information of the newly created process.

columns.name: ProcessVersionInfoInternalFileName
columns.description: Internal file name from the version information of the newly created process.

columns.name: ProcessVersionInfoOriginalFileName
columns.description: Original file name from the version information of the newly created process.

columns.name: ProcessVersionInfoFileDescription
columns.description: Description from the version information of the newly created process.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessSignerType
columns.description: Type of file signer of the process (image file) that initiated the event.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessSignatureStatus
columns.description: Information about the signature status of the process (image file) that initiated the event.

columns.name: ReportId
columns.description: Event identifier based on a repeating counter. To identify unique events, this column must be used in conjunction with the ComputerName and EventTime columns..

columns.name: SHA1
columns.description: SHA-1 hash of the file that the recorded action was applied to.

columns.name: SHA256
columns.description: SHA-256 of the file that the recorded action was applied to.

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: Date and time the event was recorded by the MDE agent on the endpoint.

columns.name: Timestamp
columns.description: Date and time the event was recorded by the MDE agent on the endpoint. This is identical to TimeGenerated and added for query portability from MDATP Advanced Hunting.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessParentCreationTime
columns.description: Date and time when the parent of the process responsible for the event was started.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessCreationTime
columns.description: Date and time when the process that initiated the event was started.

columns.name: CreatedProcessSessionId
columns.description: Windows session ID of the created process.

columns.name: IsProcessRemoteSession
columns.description: Indicates whether the created process was run under a remote desktop protocol (RDP) session (true) or locally (false).

columns.name: ProcessRemoteSessionDeviceName
columns.description: Device name of the remote device from which the created process’s RDP session was initiated.

columns.name: ProcessRemoteSessionIP
columns.description: IP address of the remote device from which the created process’s RDP session was initiated.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessSessionId
columns.description: Windows session ID of the initiating process.

columns.name: IsInitiatingProcessRemoteSession
columns.description: Indicates whether the initiating process was run under a remote desktop protocol (RDP) session (true) or locally (false).

columns.name: InitiatingProcessRemoteSessionDeviceName
columns.description: Device name of the remote device from which the initiating process’s RDP session was initiated.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessRemoteSessionIP
columns.description: IP address of the remote device from which the initiating process’s RDP session was initiated.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessUniqueId
columns.description: Unique identifier of the initiating process; this is equal to the Process Start Key in Windows devices.

columns.name: ProcessUniqueId
columns.description: Unique identifier of the process; this is equal to the Process Start Key in Windows devices.

tables.name: DeviceRegistryEvents
tables.description: Microsoft Defender for Endpoints (MDE) device registry events table. This table contains contains creation and modification of registry entries on the endpoint, and information about the processes initiating such events.

columns.name: ActionType
columns.description: Type of activity that triggered the event.

columns.name: AppGuardContainerId
columns.description: Identifier for the virtualized container used by Application Guard to isolate browser activity.

columns.name: DeviceId
columns.description: Unique identifier for the device in the service.

columns.name: DeviceName
columns.description: Fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the device.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessAccountDomain
columns.description: Domain of the account that ran the initiating process.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessAccountName
columns.description: User name of the account that ran the initiating process.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessAccountObjectId
columns.description: Azure AD object ID of the user account that ran the initiating process.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessAccountSid
columns.description: Security Identifier (SID) of the account that ran the initiating process.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessAccountUpn
columns.description: User principal name (UPN) of the account that ran the initiating process.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessCommandLine
columns.description: Command line used to run the initiating process.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessFileName
columns.description: Name of the initiating process.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessFolderPath
columns.description: Folder containing the initiating process (image file).

columns.name: InitiatingProcessId
columns.description: Process ID (PID) of the initiating process.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessIntegrityLevel
columns.description: Integrity level of the initiating process. Windows assigns integrity levels to processes based on certain characteristics, such as if they were launched from an internet download. These integrity levels influence permissions to resources..

columns.name: InitiatingProcessMD5
columns.description: MD5 hash of the initiating process (image file).

columns.name: InitiatingProcessParentFileName
columns.description: Name of the parent process that spawned the initiating process.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessParentId
columns.description: Process ID (PID) of the parent process that spawned the initiating process.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessSHA1
columns.description: SHA-1 hash of the initiating process (image file).

columns.name: InitiatingProcessSHA256
columns.description: SHA-256 hash of the initiating process (image file). In some cases this column may not be populated - please use the InitiatingProcessSHA1 column instead.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessTokenElevation
columns.description: Token type indicating the presence or absence of User Access Control (UAC) privilege elevation applied to the initiating process.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessFileSize
columns.description: The size of the file (bytes) that ran the process responsible for the event.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessVersionInfoCompanyName
columns.description: The company name in version information (image file) responsible for the event.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessVersionInfoProductName
columns.description: The product name in version information (image file) responsible for the event.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessVersionInfoProductVersion
columns.description: The product version in version information (image file) responsible for the event.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessVersionInfoInternalFileName
columns.description: The internal file name in version information (image file) responsible for the event.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessVersionInfoOriginalFileName
columns.description: The original file name in version information (image file) responsible for the event.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessVersionInfoFileDescription
columns.description: The description in version information (image file) responsible for the event.

columns.name: MachineGroup
columns.description: Machine group of the machine. This group is used by role-based access control to determine access to the machine.

columns.name: PreviousRegistryKey
columns.description: Original registry key before it was modified.

columns.name: PreviousRegistryValueData
columns.description: Original data of the registry value before it was modified.

columns.name: PreviousRegistryValueName
columns.description: Original name of the registry value before it was modified.

columns.name: RegistryKey
columns.description: Registry key that the recorded action was applied to.

columns.name: RegistryValueData
columns.description: Data of the registry value that the recorded action was applied to.

columns.name: RegistryValueName
columns.description: Name of the registry value that the recorded action was applied to.

columns.name: RegistryValueType
columns.description: Data type, such as binary or string, of the registry value that the recorded action was applied to.

columns.name: ReportId
columns.description: Event identifier based on a repeating counter. To identify unique events, this column must be used in conjunction with the ComputerName and EventTime columns..

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: Date and time the event was recorded by the MDE agent on the endpoint.

columns.name: Timestamp
columns.description: Date and time the event was recorded by the MDE agent on the endpoint. This is identical to TimeGenerated and added for query portability from MDATP Advanced Hunting.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessParentCreationTime
columns.description: Date and time when the parent of the process responsible for the event was started.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessCreationTime
columns.description: Date and time when the process that initiated the event was started.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessSessionId
columns.description: Windows session ID of the initiating process.

columns.name: IsInitiatingProcessRemoteSession
columns.description: Indicates whether the initiating process was run under a remote desktop protocol (RDP) session (true) or locally (false).

columns.name: InitiatingProcessRemoteSessionDeviceName
columns.description: Device name of the remote device from which the initiating process’s RDP session was initiated.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessRemoteSessionIP
columns.description: IP address of the remote device from which the initiating process’s RDP session was initiated.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessUniqueId
columns.description: Unique identifier of the initiating process; this is equal to the Process Start Key in Windows devices.

tables.name: DeviceInfo
tables.description: This table is part of Microsoft Defender for Endpoints with Azure Sentinel. This table contains Machine information, including OS information.

columns.name: TenantId
columns.description: Users WorkspaceId.
Additional information about the entity or event.

columns.name: ClientVersion
columns.description: Version of the endpoint agent or sensor running on the machine.

columns.name: DeviceId
columns.description: Unique identifier for the device in the service.

columns.name: DeviceName
columns.description: Fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the device.

columns.name: DeviceObjectId
columns.description: Unique identifier for the device in Azure AD.

columns.name: IsAzureADJoined
columns.description: Boolean indicator of whether machine is joined to the Azure Active Directory.
List of all users that are logged on the machine at the time of the event in JSON array format.

columns.name: MachineGroup
columns.description: Machine group used to determine access to the machine and apply group-specific settings.

columns.name: OSArchitecture
columns.description: Architecture of the operating system running on the machine.

columns.name: OSBuild
columns.description: Build version of the operating system running on the machine.

columns.name: OSPlatform
columns.description: Platform of the operating system running on the machine. This indicates specific operating systems, including variations within the same family, such as Windows 10 and Windows 7.

columns.name: OSVersion
columns.description: Version of the operating system running on the machine.

columns.name: PublicIP
columns.description: Public IP address used by the onboarded machine to connect to the Windows Defender ATP service. This could be the IP address of the machine itself, a NAT device, or a proxy.

columns.name: RegistryDeviceTag
columns.description: Device tag added through the registry.

columns.name: ReportId
columns.description: Event identifier based on a repeating counter. To identify unique events, this column must be used in conjunction with the ComputerName and EventTime columns..

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: Date and time the event was recorded by the MDE agent on the endpoint.

columns.name: Timestamp
columns.description: Date and time the event was recorded by the MDE agent on the endpoint. This is identical to TimeGenerated and added for query portability from MDATP Advanced Hunting.

columns.name: AadDeviceId
columns.description: Unique identifier for the device in Azure Active Directory.

columns.name: DeviceCategory
columns.description: Broader classification that groups certain device types under the following categories: Endpoint, Network device, IoT, Unknown.

columns.name: DeviceSubtype
columns.description: Additional modifier for certain types of devices, for example, a mobile device can be a tablet or a smartphone; only available if device discovery finds enough information about this attribute.

columns.name: DeviceType
columns.description: Type of device based on purpose and functionality, such as network device, workstation, server, mobile, gaming console, or printer.

columns.name: JoinType
columns.description: The device's Azure Active Directory join type.

columns.name: MergedDeviceIds
columns.description: Previous device IDs that have been assigned to the same device.

columns.name: MergedToDeviceId
columns.description: The most recent device ID assigned to a device.

columns.name: Model
columns.description: Model name or number of the product from the vendor or manufacturer, only available if device discovery finds enough information about this attribute.

columns.name: OnboardingStatus
columns.description: Indicates whether the device is currently onboarded or not to Microsoft Defender for Endpoint or if the device is not supported.

columns.name: OSDistribution
columns.description: Distribution of the OS platform, such as Ubuntu or RedHat for Linux platforms.

columns.name: OSVersionInfo
columns.description: Additional information about the OS version, such as the popular name, code name, or version number.

columns.name: Vendor
columns.description: Name of the product vendor or manufacturer, only available if device discovery finds enough information about this attribute.

columns.name: SensorHealthState
columns.description: Indicates health of the device’s EDR sensor, if onboarded to Microsoft Defender For Endpoint.

columns.name: IsExcluded
columns.description: Determines if the device is currently excluded from Microsoft Defender for Vulnerability Management experiences.

columns.name: ExclusionReason
columns.description: Indicates the reason for device exclusion.

columns.name: AssetValue
columns.description: Indicates the value of a device as assigned by the user.

columns.name: ExposureLevel
columns.description: Indicates the exposure level of a device.

columns.name: IsInternetFacing
columns.description: Indicates whether the device is internet-facing.

columns.name: DeviceManualTags
columns.description: Device tags created manually using the portal UI or public API.

columns.name: DeviceDynamicTags
columns.description: Device tags added and removed dynamically based on dynamic rules.

columns.name: AzureResourceId
columns.description: Unique identifier of the Azure resource associated with the device.

columns.name: AwsResourceName
columns.description: Unique identifier of the AWS resource associated with the device.

columns.name: GcpFullResourceName
columns.description: Unique identifier of the AWS resource associated with the device.

columns.name: AzureVmId
columns.description: Unique identifier assigned to the device in Azure.

columns.name: AzureVmSubscriptionId
columns.description: Unique identifier of the Azure subscription associated with the device.

columns.name: CloudPlatforms
columns.description: Thse cloud platforms that the device belongs to-can be Azure, Amazon Web Services, Google Cloud Platform and Azure Arc.

columns.name: HardwareUuid
columns.description: Universally Unique Identifier (UUID) of the device’s hardware.

columns.name: HostDeviceId
columns.description: Device ID of the device running Windows Subsystem for Linux.

columns.name: IsTransient
columns.description: Indicates whether this device is classified as short-lived or transient based on the frequency of appearance of the device on the network.

columns.name: MitigationStatus
columns.description: Indicates the mitigation action applied to a device.

columns.name: OsBuildRevision
columns.description: Build revision number of the operating system running on the machine.

tables.name: DeviceFileEvents
tables.description: This table is part of Microsoft Defender for Endpoints with Azure Sentinel. This table contains file creation, modification, and other file system events.

columns.name: ActionType
columns.description: Type of activity that triggered the event.
Additional information about the entity or event.

columns.name: AppGuardContainerId
columns.description: Identifier for the virtualized container used by Application Guard to isolate browser activity.

columns.name: DeviceId
columns.description: Unique identifier for the device in the service.

columns.name: DeviceName
columns.description: Fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the device.

columns.name: FileName
columns.description: Name of the file that the recorded action was applied to.

columns.name: FileOriginIP
columns.description: IP address where the file was downloaded from.

columns.name: FileOriginReferrerUrl
columns.description: URL of the web page that links to the downloaded file.

columns.name: FileOriginUrl
columns.description: URL where the file was downloaded from.
Size of the file in bytes.

columns.name: FolderPath
columns.description: Folder containing the file that the recorded action was applied to.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessAccountDomain
columns.description: Domain of the account that ran the process responsible for the event.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessAccountName
columns.description: User name of the account that ran the process responsible for the event.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessAccountObjectId
columns.description: Azure AD object ID of the user account that ran the process responsible for the event.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessAccountSid
columns.description: Security Identifier (SID) of the account that ran the process responsible for the event.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessAccountUpn
columns.description: User principal name (UPN) of the account that ran the process responsible for the event.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessCommandLine
columns.description: Command line used to run the process that initiated the event.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessFileName
columns.description: Name of the process that initiated the event.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessFolderPath
columns.description: Folder containing the process (image file) that initiated the event.
Process ID (PID) of the process that initiated the event.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessIntegrityLevel
columns.description: Integrity level of the process that initiated the event. Windows assigns integrity levels to processes based on certain characteristics, such as if they were launched from an internet download. These integrity levels influence permissions to resources.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessMD5
columns.description: MD5 hash of the process (image file) that initiated the event.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessParentFileName
columns.description: Name of the parent process that spawned the process responsible for the event.
Process ID (PID) of the parent process that spawned the process responsible for the event.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessSHA1
columns.description: SHA-1 hash of the process (image file) that initiated the event.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessSHA256
columns.description: SHA-256 hash of the process (image file) that initiated the event. This field is usually not populated - use the SHA1 column when available.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessTokenElevation
columns.description: Token type indicating the presence or absence of User Access Control (UAC) privilege elevation applied to the process that initiated the event.

columns.name: IsAzureInfoProtectionApplied
columns.description: Indicates whether the file is encrypted by Azure Information Protection.

columns.name: MD5
columns.description: MD5 hash of the file that the recorded action was applied to.

columns.name: MachineGroup
columns.description: Machine group of the machine. This group is used by role-based access control to determine access to the machine.

columns.name: PreviousFileName
columns.description: Original name of the file that was renamed as a result of the action.

columns.name: PreviousFolderPath
columns.description: Original folder containing the file before the recorded action was applied.

columns.description: Domain of the account used to remotely initiate the activity.

columns.name: RequestAccountSid

columns.name: RequestProtocol

columns.name: RequestSourceIP
columns.description: IPv4 or IPv6 address of the remote device that initiated the activity.

columns.name: RequestSourcePort
columns.description: Source port on the remote device that initiated the activity.

columns.name: SHA1
columns.description: SHA-1 hash of the file that the recorded action was applied to.

columns.name: SHA256
columns.description: SHA-256 of the file that the recorded action was applied to.

columns.name: SensitivityLabel
columns.description: Label applied to an email, file, or other content to classify it for information protection.

columns.name: SensitivitySubLabel
columns.description: Sublabel applied to an email, file, or other content to classify it for information protection; sensitivity sublabels are grouped under sensitivity labels but are treated independently.

columns.name: ShareName

columns.name: InitiatingProcessParentCreationTime

columns.name: InitiatingProcessCreationTime
columns.description: Date and time when the process that initiated the event was started.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessFileSize
columns.description: Size in bytes of the process (image file) that initiated the event.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessVersionInfoCompanyName
columns.description: Company name from the version information of the process (image file) responsible for the event.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessVersionInfoFileDescription
columns.description: Description from the version information of the process (image file) responsible for the event.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessVersionInfoInternalFileName

columns.name: InitiatingProcessVersionInfoOriginalFileName
columns.description: Original file name from the version information of the process (image file) responsible for the event.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessVersionInfoProductName

columns.name: InitiatingProcessVersionInfoProductVersion
columns.description: Product version from the version information of the process (image file) responsible for the event.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessSessionId
columns.description: Windows session ID of the initiating process.

columns.name: IsInitiatingProcessRemoteSession
columns.description: Indicates whether the initiating process was run under a remote desktop protocol (RDP) session (true) or locally (false).

columns.name: InitiatingProcessRemoteSessionDeviceName
columns.description: Device name of the remote device from which the initiating process’s RDP session was initiated.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessRemoteSessionIP
columns.description: IP address of the remote device from which the initiating process’s RDP session was initiated.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessUniqueId
columns.description: Unique identifier of the initiating process; this is equal to the Process Start Key in Windows devices.

columns.description: Integrity level of the process that initiated the event. Windows assigns integrity levels to processes based on certain characteristics, such as if they were launched from an internet download. These integrity levels influence permissions to resources.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessSHA256
columns.description: SHA-256 hash of the process (image file) that initiated the event. This field is usually not populated - use the SHA1 column when available.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessTokenElevation
columns.description: Token type indicating the presence or absence of User Access Control (UAC) privilege elevation applied to the process that initiated the event.

columns.name: IsLocalAdmin
columns.description: Boolean indicator of whether the user is a local administrator on the machine.

columns.name: LogonId
columns.description: Identifier for a logon session. This identifier is unique on the same machine only between restarts.

columns.name: LogonType
columns.description: Type of logon session, specifically interactive, remote interactive (RDP), network, batch, and service.

columns.name: MachineGroup
columns.description: Machine group of the machine. This group is used by role-based access control to determine access to the machine.

columns.name: Protocol
columns.description: Protocol used during the communication.

columns.name: RemoteDeviceName
columns.description: Name of the device that performed a remote operation on the affected machine. Depending on the event being reported, this name could be a fully-qualified domain name (FQDN), a NetBIOS name, or a host name without domain information.

columns.name: RemoteIP
columns.description: IP address that was being connected to.

columns.name: RemoteIPType
columns.description: Type of IP address, for example Public, Private, Reserved, Loopback, Teredo, FourToSixMapping, and Broadcast.

columns.name: RemotePort
columns.description: TCP port on the remote device that was being connected to.

columns.name: ReportId
columns.description: Event identifier based on a repeating counter. To identify unique events, this column must be used in conjunction with the ComputerName and EventTime columns.

columns.name: Timestamp
columns.description: Date and time the event was recorded by the MDE agent on the endpoint. This is identical to TimeGenerated and added for query portability from MDATP Advanced Hunting.

columns.description: Product name from the version information of the process (image file) responsible for the event.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessVersionInfoProductVersion
columns.description: Product version from the version information of the process (image file) responsible for the event.

columns.name: ProcessCreationTime
columns.description: Date and time the process was created.

columns.name: CreatedProcessSessionId
columns.description: Windows session ID of the created process.

columns.name: IsProcessRemoteSession
columns.description: Indicates whether the created process was run under a remote desktop protocol (RDP) session (true) or locally (false).

columns.name: ProcessRemoteSessionDeviceName
columns.description: Device name of the remote device from which the created process’s RDP session was initiated.

columns.name: ProcessRemoteSessionIP
columns.description: IP address of the remote device from which the created process’s RDP session was initiated.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessSessionId
columns.description: Windows session ID of the initiating process.

columns.name: IsInitiatingProcessRemoteSession
columns.description: Indicates whether the initiating process was run under a remote desktop protocol (RDP) session (true) or locally (false).

columns.name: InitiatingProcessRemoteSessionDeviceName
columns.description: Device name of the remote device from which the initiating process’s RDP session was initiated.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessRemoteSessionIP
columns.description: IP address of the remote device from which the initiating process’s RDP session was initiated.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessUniqueId
columns.description: Unique identifier of the initiating process; this is equal to the Process Start Key in Windows devices.

tables.name: DeviceFileCertificateInfo
tables.description: Certificate information of signed files obtained from certificate verification events on endpoints.

columns.name: CertificateSerialNumber
columns.description: Identifier for the certificate that is unique to the issuing certificate authority (CA).

columns.name: CrlDistributionPointUrls
columns.description: A list of network shares URLs that contains certificates and certificate revocation (CRLs).

columns.name: DeviceId
columns.description: Unique identifier for the device in the service.

columns.name: DeviceName
columns.description: Fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the device.

columns.name: IsRootSignerMicrosoft
columns.description: Indicates whether the signer of the root certificate is Microsoft.

columns.name: IsSigned
columns.description: Indicates whether the file is signed.

columns.name: IsTrusted
columns.description: Indicates whether the file is trusted based on the results of the WinVerifyTrust function, which checks for unknown root certificate information, invalid signatures, revoked certificates, and other questionable attributes.

columns.name: Issuer
columns.description: Information about the issuing certificate authority (CA).

columns.name: IssuerHash
columns.description: Unique hash value identifying issuing certificate authority (CA).

columns.name: MachineGroup
columns.description: Machine group of the machine. This group is used by role-based access control to determine access to the machine.

columns.name: ReportId
columns.description: Unique identifier for the event.

columns.name: SHA1
columns.description: SHA-1 hash of the file that the recorded action was applied to.

columns.name: SignatureType
columns.description: Indicates whether signature information was read as embedded content in the file itself or read from an external catalog file.

columns.name: Signer
columns.description: Information about the signer of the file.

columns.name: SignerHash
columns.description: Unique hash value identifying the signer.

columns.name: Timestamp
columns.description: Date and time the event was recorded by the MDE agent on the endpoint. This is identical to TimeGenerated and added for query portability from MDATP Advanced Hunting.

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: Date and time the event was recorded by the MDE agent on the endpoint.

columns.name: CertificateCountersignatureTime
columns.description: Date and time (UTC) the certificate was countersigned.

columns.name: CertificateCreationTime
columns.description: Date and time (UTC) the certificate was created.

columns.name: CertificateExpirationTime
columns.description: Certificate expiry date and time (UTC).

tables.name: DynamicEventCollection
tables.description: Microsoft Defender for Endpoints (MDE) table for generic windows events. Fields of the raw events are available as part of the AdditionalFields column.

columns.name: AccountSid
columns.description: Security identifier (SID) of the account.

columns.name: AdditionalFields
columns.description: Additional information about the entity or event.

columns.name: AppGuardContainerId
columns.description: Identifier for the virtualized container used by Application Guard to isolate browser activity.

columns.name: DeviceId
columns.description: Unique identifier for the device in the service.

columns.name: DeviceName
columns.description: Fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the device.

columns.name: EventId
columns.description: Contains the unique event identifier.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessAccountDomain
columns.description: Domain of the account that ran the process responsible for the event.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessAccountName
columns.description: User name of the account that ran the process responsible for the event.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessAccountObjectId
columns.description: Azure AD object ID of the user account that ran the process responsible for the event.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessAccountSid
columns.description: Security Identifier (SID) of the account that ran the process responsible for the event.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessAccountUpn
columns.description: User principal name (UPN) of the account that ran the process responsible for the event. In Active Directory, a UPN is the name of a system user in an email address format (for example: john.doe@domain.com)

columns.name: InitiatingProcessFolderPath
columns.description: Folder containing the process (image file) that initiated the event.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessId
columns.description: Process ID (PID) of the process that initiated the event.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessLogonId
columns.description: Identifier for a logon session of the process that initiated the event. This identifier is unique on the same machine only between restarts.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessMD5
columns.description: MD5 hash of the process (image file) that initiated the event.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessParentFileName
columns.description: Name of the parent process that spawned the process responsible for the event.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessParentId
columns.description: Process ID (PID) of the parent process that spawned the process responsible for the event.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessSHA1
columns.description: SHA-1 hash of the process (image file) that initiated the event.

columns.name: LocalIP
columns.description: IP address assigned to the local machine used during communication.

columns.name: LocalPort
columns.description: TCP port on the local machine used during communication.

columns.name: MachineGroup
columns.description: Machine group of the machine. This group is used by role-based access control to determine access to the machine.

columns.name: ProcessCommandLine
columns.description: Command line used to create the new process.

columns.name: RemoteDeviceName
columns.description: Name of the device that performed a remote operation on the affected machine. Depending on the event being reported, this name could be a fully-qualified domain name (FQDN), a NetBIOS name, or a host name without domain information..

columns.name: RemoteIP
columns.description: IP address that was being connected to.

columns.name: RemotePort
columns.description: TCP port on the remote device that was being connected to.

columns.name: ReportId
columns.description: Unique identifier for the event.

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: Date and time the event was recorded by the MDE agent on the endpoint.

columns.name: Timestamp
columns.description: Date and time the event was recorded by the MDE agent on the endpoint.
